articles.title: Bioluminescent Waves Mesmerize California Beachgoers, Surfers - EcoWatch
articles.description: Beachgoers in California are enjoying a dazzling display of crashing bioluminescent waves in Southern California. The waves light up at night as they crash and froth in the shallow water, The Guardian reported.

articles.title: Astronomers discover black hole closer to Earth than any before, suggest it may not be alone - ABC Science Online
articles.description: Black hole's usually cannot be seen but astronomers have now discovered one closer to Earth than any that have ever been located before.
articles.content:
We've got a new galactic neighbour a small black hole left over from the death of a fleeting young star. Key points:
  • The black hole is tiny, only 40km in diameter
  • It is not close enough to swallow anything, but it is warping the orbit of its… [+2717 chars]

articles.description: The explosion over Siberia—which has come to be known as the "Tunguska event"—has long puzzled experts.
articles.content:

articles.author: RT
articles.title: Chinese scientists harness fourth state of matter to create ‘air plasma’ jet engine that runs on electricity alone - RT
articles.description: Scientists in Wuhan, China claim to have created a carbon-neutral prototype jet engine which could one day allow for a new era in fossil-fuel free manned flight.
articles.content: Their prototype engine compresses air and ionizes it with microwaves thus generating plasma which it expels out the back of the engine to generate thrust. Plasma is the fourth state of matter which usually only exists in the laboratory, the surface of the Sun… [+1673 chars]
